Recap: Danny and Michelle decide to leave Springfield and go to Louisiana to help Ed with the flood victims. They say good-byes to all of their loved ones in town. Danny finds Marina and tearfully tells her that he and Michelle were remarried and are leaving town. He gives her a letter that he wrote for her and leaves. Marina reads the letter and it brings her to tears and when Alan Michael goes by, she asks if the offer still stands for her to take his car out. Since she can't drive a stick Alan-Michael puts her in the passenger seat and they take off. When they get back Alan-Michael hits on her again. Tammy leaves the house the morning of her wedding and Jeffrey, Cassie, and Sandy worry until she comes home. Sandy hides at Cassie's insistence but she decides who cares about tradition and Tammy and Sandy go off for a lunch together, where he gives her a strand of fake pearls. Ava tries to convince Jonathan to skip town with her and not go to the wedding, but he insists that Tammy is going to call it off and he wants to be there for her. Reva gives Sandy some Lewis family cufflinks and Tammy returns to the farm to find a package with the groom from the bakery waiting for her.
Transcript: Tammy: Reverend Rutledge, you scared me.
Reverend Rutledge: Couldn't sleep?
Tammy: I'm sorry, I just... I wanted....
Reverend Rutledge: Tammy, is everything okay?
Tammy: Dream come true.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: Is anyone still asleep in this town? Yeah? Whoa, whoa, whoa. You cannot come in here.
Sandy: Yeah, I know, the groom's not suppose to see the bride before the wedding, but I don't believe in superstitions or going a day without a Tammy fix.
Jeffrey: Oh, really.
Cassie: Tammy? Jeffrey?
Jeffrey: What's wrong?
Cassie: Tammy's not in her bed. She's... gone.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: You look like you've been up all night.
Jonathan: Maybe because I have.
Reva: Thinking about Tammy? Don't go to that wedding, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Oh, no, I want to be there when Tammy tells Sandy that she's not going to marry him. Which is what's going to happen.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: All right. That's it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Michelle: Grandpa Ed sends his love.
Danny: Yeah?
Robbie: From California?
Danny: No, he's in Louisiana now, remember?
Michelle: He's helping lot of sick people there who haven't had any doctors because of the flooding.
Danny: How's he doing?
Michelle: He's exhausted, but exhilarated. He loves what he does. I just wish he didn't have to spend Thanksgiving alone.
Danny: Well, maybe he doesn't have to. We could go down there.
Michelle: Yeah, take a quick trip down south to carve a turkey?
Danny: Yeah. Or we could, um, stay there.
Michelle: You're serious?
Danny: Yeah, I'm serious. Look, I know how much you miss working at the clinic. I see it on your face every time that you talk to your dad or when Rick talks about work.
Michelle: Well, there's just a lot of people that are need of decent medical care and some children at risk.

Danny: Why don't we go down there and see if we can help. You know? And then when your dad goes back out to California, maybe we can go out west with him. Why not? Make a fresh start? Leave behind all the mistakes we've made in Springfield. What do you think?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Ava!
Ava: Hey. Marina. Hi.
Marina: Will I see you at the wedding tonight?
Ava: Oh, um, I don't know. There's just something about weddings...
Marina: Yeah, but sometimes it's good to see how happy two people can make each other.
Ava: Most marriages fall apart.
Marina: Yeah. A lot do, but if two people love each other enough to give it an honest shot I say why not?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Michelle: Could we really just pack up and leave? I mean...
Danny: Yeah. If we're moving on to something better than this, why not?
Michelle: Well, I guess I could work with my dad in his clinic, and you could start a business.
Danny: Right. Little man can learn how to surf! He's already got the blond hair, right, dude?
Michelle: ( Laughs ) you've been thinking about this for a while.
Danny: I know it's a big change. It's a big step. But I don't know. I just think it would be really good for our family.
Michelle: Our family. Let's do it.
Danny: Yeah? All right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Jonathan, Tammy is marrying Sandy tonight.
Jonathan: Uh-huh.

Reva: Listen to me. That is why I sent you to the bakery. I ignored what my head was telling me to do and I listened to my heart instead. I wanted to make sure that Tammy was making the right decision for herself no matter what it was. I told her that if she chose you over Sandy, that I would support that decision. I would support both of you no matter who turned against you.
Jonathan: You're serious? You would do that for me?

Reva: Of course I would. But I also told Tammy that she had to tell me the truth, straight from her heart. And she told me that no matter how strong her feelings were for you, she couldn't live with the decision to be with you because it was too scary and it was too um... there's something else, too. She genuinely loves Sandy.
Jonathan: That doesn't mean she's going to marry him.
Reva: Marrying him she said was the right decision. And I have to support that decision no matter what.
Jonathan: Sure you do.
Reva: She's made her choice. She's made her choice.
Jonathan: I don't care what she told you, Reva! By the end of the night, she will not be married to Sandy.
Reva: You don't want to just change her mind anymore, do you? You're planning to stop that wedding.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sandy: Well, have you seen Tammy this morning? Where could she have gone?
Cassie: I don't know. Maybe she went for a drive? Her car's not here. But you are, which is not allowed on the day of the wedding so bye-bye.
Sandy: Well, I can't go now until I know she's okay.
Cassie: It's her. Hide. Make sure he keeps out of sight. Hide!
Jeffrey: Go, go.
Cassie: And I thought I was up early there morning. Where were you?
Tammy: I just... I thought I'd jump on my errands early.
Cassie: In your pajamas.
Tammy: Would you rather I wore my wedding dress?
Cassie: Sweetheart, are you all right?
Tammy: Sure, I've got a guy who loves me and...
Cassie: And you are going to be the most beautiful bride ever. Not that I'm biased or anything. Did you eat? Oh, that's a dumb question, of course you didn't. Tammy? Honey?
Tammy: Mom, I have to tell you something. And I have to do it now before the wedding. I can't hold it in anymore.
Tammy: I don't know how to say this or even where to start but I...
Cassie: What is it, honey? Just say it.

Tammy: I need... I need to tell you that I... I love you. And you... you mean more to me than anything. Mom, we've lived in shacks and in palaces, but it didn't matter where we were because I always had you to make every place home. Thank you.

Cassie: Sweetie... all I ever wanted was for you to have a better life than I did. For you to not be scarred by all those years in the foster homes. For you to find someone to love you the way Sandy does.
Tammy: So far so good.
Cassie: Thank god. And speaking of Sandy, there's something I need to tell you, too. He's here.
Tammy: What? Right now?
Cassie: Um, yeah. I kind of stashed him so he wouldn't see you, but I'm not good at this rules thing so if you want to see him I will leave it up to you. I'll just tell you he's not over there.
Jeffrey: All that and you cave in.
Cassie: It's her wedding day!
Tammy: You know what this wedding really needs is a marching band and a bear on a unicycle.
Sandy: Hey, gorgeous.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: ( Humming the wedding march ) you know, I've heard, Ava, that some people find their soul mates at weddings. Who knows, maybe we'll...
Danny: Hey.
Ava: Um... I'm going to go to breakfast.
Marina: I thought my dad told you that he'd knock you out if you came within ten feet of me.
Danny: How's this? Is this safe?
Marina: Come here. So, let me guess. You just had to have some of those Company hash browns this morning.
Danny: No, I had to see you.
Marina: You did?
Danny: Mm-hm. Yeah, there's something that I have to tell you.
Marina: Okay. Shoot.
Danny: Last night Michelle and I got married again.
Marina: Oh.
Danny: Marina, I just wanted you to hear it from me instead of from somebody else.
Marina: Wow. Congratulations.
Danny: Thanks.
Marina: I'm happy for you.
Danny: Well, there is something else.
Marina: Oh, goody!
Danny: Michelle and I are leaving. We're... we're going to go help her dad.
Marina: Wow.
Danny: Yeah.
Marina: That's great!
Danny: This is for you.
Marina: Is this your new address?
Danny: No, I just... there's some things I wanted to... say to you and... you know, I just thought I'd write it down and you'll know that way...
Marina: Danny....
Danny: ...If you don't want to read it you can just throw it out.
Marina: You don't have to do this.
Danny: No, no, I want to.
Marina: I'm fine.
Danny: I know. I wanted to. I wanted to.
Marina: So is this happening soon? You're leaving?

Danny: Yeah. So, take care of yourself, okay? "Dear Marina. I didn't want to never see you again without telling you all the things I've loved about you and how beautiful you are inside and out, your kindness and how much fun you are. You've filled my life with so much of it when I really thought there was none left. And you make a mean muzaka. But most of all, I've loved your passion and not just for us, but for what's right. That passion led me to Michelle and to our little girl. And if it weren't for you, I wouldn't have my daughter. Thank you for that, and everything else you've given me: Your heart, your humor and all the great memories. You be happy, Marina, you deserve it. Love, Danny."
Marina: Hey! You still have that fancy little sports car, the one you like to drive too fast?
Alan-Michael: I might. Who wants to know?
Marina: I do.
Alan-Michael: Why's that?
Marina: I feel like driving too fast.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Let's just give them some time alone.
Jeffrey: Okay, yeah sure. While we freeze out here.
Cassie: There are things we could do to keep that from happening.
Jeffrey: Oh, yeah?
Cassie: Mm-hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: We really shouldn't be seeing each other.
Sandy: But then I couldn't do this. And I don't think I could last a day without that. And I thought you might need me.
Tammy: For what?
Sandy: To remind you that what we're doing today is what we both want. Am I right?
Tammy: You're totally right. For me.
Sandy: I knew that. Now, let's get out of here.
Tammy: And go where?
Sandy: It's a surprise, come on.
Tammy: Sandy, I can't leave. I have to do my hair and my nails and I have to check on the flowers and call about the limos.
Sandy: That's it.
Tammy: If I don't get everything...
Sandy: That can wait! They don't start the wedding without us.
Tammy: You're crazy!
Sandy: In love! Come on!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: I'm not going to torch the church if that's what you're thinking.
Reva: So what are you going to do?
Jonathan: Um, nothing. I'm just going to go as a guest.
Reva: You're just going to sit there and watch?
Jonathan: Don't look at me like that!
Reva: I don't want to see you get hurt. What?
Jonathan: You want to protect me?
Reva: You're my kid!
Jonathan: I'm just used to being the bad guy.
Reva: I'm on your side.
Jonathan: Yeah.
Reva: Skip the wedding!
Jonathan: No!

Reva: I don't think you're going to cause any trouble. At least I want to believe that you're not going to cause any trouble. But why do you want to do this to yourself? Why do you want to go there and watch Tammy marry him. Why do you want to watch him put a wedding ring on her finger? Watch him kiss his bride.
Jonathan: It's not going to happen.
Reva: Why do you want to do this to yourself?
Jonathan: I have faith.
Reva: Based on what?
Jonathan: Isn't that the purpose of faith? I mean, I might not be people's choice, like Sandy, but I will be Tammy's choice.
Reva: She's not like us, Jonathan. Going with you would be like jumping off a cliff for her.

Jonathan: Then I'll catch her. Look, Reva, I am going to that wedding tonight. If you need me, I'll be sitting on the bride's side. Afterwards, she'll be coming home with me. Now, you, young lady, you go get ready for this thing. Home. Now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: She's gotten so big. What's wrong? Hope isn't sick, is she?
Michelle: No, no, she's fine. She's great. I just wanted you to see her in case...
Cassie: In case what?
Michelle: Can we come inside? Would that be okay?
Cassie: Of course.
Jeffrey: Yeah, please.
Cassie: Tammy?
Jeffrey: Oh, looks like she... she might have gone awol again with the future husband this time.
Michelle: It's a big day for you guys, right?
Cassie: The biggest.
Michelle: I'm really, really happy for you guys.
Cassie: Thank you. So what's um... what's going on?
Michelle: I guess there's a little wedding fever in the air. You know, Danny and I got married again.
Cassie: Good for you!
Jeffrey: You didn't call me this time.

Michelle: No, not this time. And we're... we're thinking about moving to be with my dad. It's not definite yet. But I would be able to work with my dad in his clinic and Danny was thinking about starting a new business.
Cassie: Wow. Well, that sounds great.
Michelle: Cassie, if this is going to be too hard on you... I mean, moving Hope away.
Cassie: Michelle, if... if moving your family is going to make you and Danny happy, as happy as I am, then you have to do it.
Michelle: We're going to come back on the holidays and we would definitely visit you wherever we're in town, I promise.
Cassie: And I might want to fly out and visit sometimes if that's okay.
Michelle: Oh, yes. Please, please. Whenever you want.
Jeffrey: Hi.
Danny: Can I come in?
Michelle: There you are.
Danny: Everybody okay?
Michelle: Yeah. You know, Hope was really, really lucky to spend some time in this house.
Cassie: Thank you. And congratulations. I'm... I'm so happy for both of you.

Danny: Thank you. Thanks. We're leaving behind some good friends. You especially. I just wanted to say good-bye to you. You know, when life was looking pretty low for me, you were the only person who stood by me. You saved my life, literally.
Cassie: Don't you dare make me cry, Santos.
Danny: All right.
Cassie: Thank you.
Danny: Take care, O'Neill.
Jeffrey: Good luck, Danny.
Danny: Thank you.
Michelle: Do you want to hold Hope one last time?
Cassie: I would. Hi, honey. Oh, sweetie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: The offer of a ride came with me included. You don't get one without the other.
Marina: I'm an officer of the law. Please step away from the car, Mr. Spaulding. I'm commandeering this hot little vehicle.
Alan-Michael: What's the emergency, officer?
Marina: I need to have some fun! ( Revs engine ) ( car stalls )
Alan-Michael: You can't drive a stick, can you?
Marina: Of course I can. I have... ( car stalls ) absolutely no idea what I'm doing.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Reva: Hey, it's me! I feel like I take up a lot of your time these days, but, heck, what's wrong with asking for a little help when you need it, right? Please. Please, whatever happens at this wedding tonight, let my family make it through. Especially Jonathan.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Let's just, I don't know, go out of town for the day or something. We could go to Oakdale or Chicago. Let's leave now, come on.
Jonathan: No. You go if you want, but I want to be at the church when Tammy stops the wedding.
Ava: You seem so sure.
Jonathan: I'm going to take her straight out of the church, put her in my car and we'll just drive. I don't know where, but it's not important, we'll figure it out.
Ava: Well, that seems like a nice dream.
Jonathan: It's not a dream.
Ava: Jonathan, I'm just trying to tell you...
Jonathan: Why do they want all the guys to look like penguin waiters and this stupid... ( laughs ) can you please help me tie that thing?
Ava: Sure. Sit down.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: All right. Can I open them yet?
Sandy: Almost. Not yet. Not yet. Okay, now. Tammy? Are you okay? What's up?
Tammy: The cake just looks so different during the day.
Sandy: You've been here before?
Tammy: Once. But it was in the dark. And seeing it now in the light, that makes all the difference in the world.
Sandy: You've never looked more beautiful than you do right now.
Tammy: ( Laughs ) even with mustard on my face?
Sandy: Especially. Oh, wait. I also brought this. It's your wedding gift.
Tammy: Sandy.
Sandy: Open it.
Tammy: Sandy, they're perfect.
Sandy: Just like you. Try them on.
Tammy: Oh, I want to save them for the wedding.
Sandy: Please try them on.
Tammy: Okay. Help me. I don't think I'll ever take them off.
Sandy: So I picked right?
Tammy: I love them, Sandy. I love you.
Sandy: No doubts? No regrets? Cold feet? Because if so, we'd better get some socks. We are going through with this.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ray: Hey, looks like the party already started. Rick.
Rick: Come in. Please join us.
Ray: What's up, tiger? Hey, Michelle.
Michelle: I'm glad that you made it.
Ray: Are you kidding me? After marrying you guys last night, I wouldn't miss saying good-bye for the world. I'm so glad you're officially back in the family.
Michelle: Thank you, me, too.
Danny: Hey.
Ray: Hey.
Danny: How are you?
Ray: Good.
Danny: Yeah.
Ray: So, Louisiana, California?
Danny: California. Yeah.
Ray: You're going, Tony's gone. Carmen's out of commission. Looks like I'm the last Santos that's left in Springfield.
Danny: Good luck. ( Laughs ) listen, I love you.
Ray: I love you, man. Do great things out there, all right? You've got nothing to stand in your way anymore. And keep in touch, you hear in?
Danny: Of course I will. You know I will. It's not good-bye.
Rick: Danny, can I talk to you for just a second?
Danny: Yeah, yeah. Sure.
Rick: Listen, I... I know you've heard this speech before but...
Danny: Uh-oh.
Rick: Please, please take care of my little sister, okay?
Danny: Rick, I know things have never really been great between us, but...

Rick: You know, Danny, we've definitely had our problems in the past, but when I see... when I see how happy she is I know it's definitely worth it. And you know what? It's going to work out this time for you.
Danny: I won't let you down.
Rick: I know you won't. It's going to work out.
Mel: Okay, you guys, we're ready to eat. Let's go.
Ray: All right.
Michelle: All right.
Rick: There we go.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Now get in here.
Marina: What?
Alan-Michael: Yes. You are severely stick challenged. But that doesn't mean you can't enjoy experience. Are you getting in or not?
Marina: I'm not always a mess you know.
Alan-Michael: Thanks for the clarification.
Marina: Hit it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: Richard?
Cassie: He loved being Tammy's dad. He used to dream about walking her down the aisle on her wedding day. And that day is here and he isn't.
Jeffrey: I guess you never get over that kind of thing.
Cassie: You go on with your life, but you never get over a sudden loss like that. And the accident... there was a wedding going on that night, too you know?
Jeffrey: I'm sorry.
Cassie: My heart was past broken. But it's back together now. In one piece because of you. So you know what?
Jeffrey: What?
Cassie: I think that once this wedding is over that I'll finally be able to put all my memories of Richard aside. Just safely and peacefully move on.
Jeffrey: Cassie, I would do anything to protect you.
Cassie: Jeffrey, I don't need you to protect me, I just need you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: Wow, it's hard to believe in a few hours we're going to be married. What do you think it will feel like?
Sandy: Ask me later. You'd better get in there and do the beautiful bride thing.
Tammy: See you later?
Sandy: It's a date. I'll see you.
Tammy: Another gift? It has my name on it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ray: Wait, wait, wait. I missed my chance to say blessing. Everybody was too hungry.
Rick: Guilty.
Ray: I can say one before dessert.
Mel: Okay.
Michelle: All right.
Rick: Let's get it in.
Ray: Real quick.
Danny: Okay, hold hands.
Ray: Ready?
Danny: Yup.
Michelle: Yes.
Ray: Okay. Okay, father, this is going to be a two-parter.
Danny: Oh, boy.

Ray: First, bless this wonderful meal and all of those who have sharing in it. Second, bless Danny, Michelle, Robbie and Hope. May they find all the happiness and laughter they deserve in the world. May they always know that though we may be thousands of miles apart, we will always be as close as we are right now. Amen.
Mel: Amen.
Michelle: Amen.
Danny: We'll always be thinking about all of you.
Michelle: Yeah. We may be moving away, but this is always going to be our home.
Danny: Until we find a few one. ( Laughter )
Michelle: Thank you guys.
Rick: Pie?
Michelle: Thank you for all the love and support?
Rick: Is it time for pie? ( Laughter ) fine, pie!
Mel: Yes, we have pie, honey. Here, give this one to Rick, please.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: ( Laughs ) you drive like a maniac!
Alan-Michael: I just know how to handle a car. How to coax her along, ease her through the curves and open her up wide.
Marina: Wow. Great pickup line.
Alan-Michael: Did it work?
Marina: No. ( Laughs ) but you did take my mind off Danny for a little while I was clutching on to the dashboard and trying to pray for my dear life.
Alan-Michael: Mission accomplished, then.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: I can only hope that you know, I can bring you and R.J. And Tammy happiness in the way that Richard did.
Cassie: You already do, Jeffrey.
Jeffrey: Promise me that you'll remember this, this moment right now, how sweet it is.
Cassie: As if I could forget.
Jeffrey: Just promise me, please.
Cassie: I promise. Now, if you're finished, let's go get my little girl married, hmm?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: It's going to be beautiful.
Sandy: Reva, you're here early.
Reva: I'm hear to pray and to actually think.
Sandy: About what?
Reva: You and Tammy, among other things. We've shared a lot since you've been in town, including vital organs.
Sandy: Yeah, well, I wouldn't be here if it weren't for you.
Reva: Now we're going to be connected in another way through someone who's very precious to me.
Sandy: Reva, I love Tammy.

Reva: I know you do. And I trust you with her. And it all starts with love. Actually, um, Josh and I wanted you to have this. They're cuff links that have been passed down through Josh's family for good luck. Worked a lot for a lot of years for Josh and I, so...
Sandy: Thanks, Reva. I promise I will take good care of her and give her everything she needs.

Reva: I know you will. ( Musical intro to Kaci Brown's "Unbelievable" ) I wish you didn't love me, I wish you'd make this easy it was love that caught me, now it's fear that keeps me with you I feel you in my shadow, my heart is cold and hollow no matter where I am I see your eyes always follow me try to hold me, try to own me, keeping something that's not yours you want to make me believe that I'm crazy, make me think that you're the cure it's unbelievable, but I believed you unforgivable, but I forgave you insane what love can do that keeps me coming back to you irreplaceable, but I've replaced you now I'm standing on my own alone you're still haunting me in my sleep, you're all I see but I can't go back because I know it's wrong for us to go on and I'm going strong to confront my fears whoa, hey, yeah, whoa it's unbelievable, but I believed you unforgivable, but I forgave you insane what love can do that keeps me coming back to you irreplaceable, but I've replaced you now I'm standing on my own alone.
[NEXT_ON]
Reva: What is it? What's wrong?
Tammy: I need help. I'm going to marry Sandy and that's what I want. Just help me get through this. Jonathan doesn't matter anymore. That's behind me.
Transcript Author: Provided By Boo Proofread By Tanya ( Mendelssohn's "Wedding March" playing ) I wish you didn't love me, I wish you'd make this easy it was love that caught me now it's fear that keeps me with you I want to be by your side so I can close my eyes to the emptiness inside that kills me when I'm with you you try to break me, try to hate me so you can fall out of love you want to make me believe that I'm crazy that I'm nothing without you it's irreplaceable but I've replaced you now I'm standing on my own...
